data.question: What is the chemical formula for the new microporous metal-organic framework discussed?
At what temperature and pressure does Cu2(PDDI) reach its highest acetylene uptake value?
What is the acetylene uptake value of ZJU-5a at 273 K and 1 bar?
What are the methane storage capacities of ZJU-5a at 35 bar and 60 bar at room temperature?
data.answer: 190 cm3 (STP) cm-3 at 35 bar and 224 cm3 (STP) cm-3 at 60 bar

data.question: What is the BET surface area of ZJU-5a?
What is the role of Lewis basic pyridyl sites in ZJU-5?
data.answer: They enhance interactions with gas molecules in addition to the open metal sites.

data.question: Is the acetylene storage capacity of ZJU-5a at 273 K and 1 bar the highest reported among any porous materials?
Does ZJU-5a have a higher methane storage capacity at 35 bar than the DOE's old target?
Are the acetylene adsorption enthalpies of ZJU-5a at lower coverages higher than those of reported MOFs of the same NbO structures?
Is the acetylene storage capacity of ZJU-5a at room temperature higher than that of HKUST-1 and CoMOF-74?
Does ZJU-5a exhibit Type-I sorption behaviour for N2 at 77 K?
Is the acetylene storage capacity of ZJU-5a at 273 K and 1 bar lower than 290 cm3/g?
Was ZJU-5 synthesized using a solvothermal method?
What is the main component of natural gas that ZJU-5a stores?
What is the significance of open metal sites in ZJU-5?
data.answer: They provide strong binding sites for gas molecules.

data.question: Why is acetylene storage under a pressure of 0.2 MPa important?
data.answer: Because acetylene is a very explosive gas.

data.question: How does the structure of ZJU-5 contribute to its high gas storage capacity?
data.answer: The structure includes open metal sites, Lewis basic pyridyl sites, and suitable pore spaces.

data.question: Why might ZJU-5a be more favorable for acetylene storage at higher pressures?
data.answer: Because it has lower acetylene uptakes at the release pressure and possibly higher uptakes at 2 bar.

data.question: What is the role of the Lewis basic pyridyl sites in acetylene storage?
data.answer: They might further enhance interaction with acetylene molecules through hydrogen bonding.
